com.github.dm.jrt.core.invocation

Interface Invocation<IN,OUT>

  • Type Parameters:
    IN - the input data type.
    OUT - the output data type.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CallInvocation, ChannelInvocation, CommandInvocation, IdentityInvocation, InvocationDecorator, MappingInvocation, RoutineInvocation, TemplateInvocation

    public interface Invocation<IN,OUT>
    Interface defining a routine invocation.

    The typical lifecycle of an invocation object is the one depicted below: 

    
                        |    -----(*)-----------------------------------
                        |   |                                           |
     ---------------    |   |    -----------------------------------    |
    |               |   |   |   |                                   |   |
    |               V   V   |   V                                   |   |
    |             -----------------                                 |   |
    |             |  onRestart()  |                                 |   |
    |             -----------------                                 |   |
    |               |     |     |                                   |   |
    |    -----------      |     |                                   |   |
    |   |                 |      ---------------------------        |   |
    |   |    -------      |                                 |       |   |
    |   |   |       |     |                                 |       |   |
    |   |   |       V     V                                 |       |   |
    |   |   |     -----------------                         |       |   |
    |   |    -----|   onInput()   |-------------------      |       |   |
    |   |         -----------------                   |     |       |   |
    |   |                 |              -------      |     |       |   |
    |   |                 |             |       |     |     |       |   |
    |   |                 |             |       V     V     V       |   |
    |    -----------      |             |     -----------------     |   |
    |               |     |            (*)    |   onAbort()   |-----    |
    |               V     V             |     -----------------         |
    |             -----------------     |             |                 |
    |             |  onComplete() |-----              |                 |
    |             -----------------                   |                 |
    |                   |                             |                 |
    |                   |    -------------------------                  |
    |                   |   |                                           |
    |        -------    |   |    ---------------------------------------
    |       |       |   |   |   |
    |       |       V   V   V   V
    |       |     -----------------
    |        -----|  onRecycle()  |
    |             -----------------
    |                     |
    |                     |
     ---------------------

 (*) only when an exception escapes the method
    The routine invocation interface is designed so to allow recycling of instantiated objects.

    Note that the onInput() method will be called for each input passed to the routine, so, in case no input is expected, the onComplete() method will be called soon after the initialization.

    Note also that onAbort() might be called at any time after onRestart() in case the invocation is aborted.

    The onRestart() method is meant to allow the reset operations needed to prepare the invocation object to be reused. When the method does not complete successfully, the invocation object is discarded.
    Note that the method will be called also right after the object instantiation.

    The onRecycle() method is meant to indicate that the invocation instance has completed its lifecycle, so any associated resource can be released. The input flag indicates if the same instance is going to be re-used or not. Note, however, that this method may never get called with false if the routine clear() method is not invoked.

    Keep in mind, when implementing an invocation class, that the result channel passed to the onInput() and onComplete() methods will be closed as soon as the latter exits.
    Any further attempt to post results will generate an exception.
    It is anyway possible to keep on generating results by passing to the result channel another channel.

    Be aware that there is no guarantee about how and when an invocation will produce a result. It might return one or more outputs for each input, or no output at all.

    Any exception escaping the invocation methods, unless it extends the base RoutineException, will be wrapped as the cause of an InvocationException instance.

    The class TemplateInvocation provides an abstract empty implementation of the invocation interface.

    Created by davide-maestroni on 09/07/2014.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onAbort(RoutineException reason)
      Called when the invocation execution is aborted.
      void onComplete(Channel<OUT,?> result)
      Called when all the inputs has been passed to the invocation.
      void onInput(IN input, Channel<OUT,?> result)
      Called when an input is passed to the routine.
      void onRecycle(boolean isReused)
      Called when the routine invocation is recycled.
      void onRestart()
      Called when the routine invocation is initialized.

    • Method Detail

      • onAbort

        void onAbort(@NotNull
             RoutineException reason)
      throws Exception
        Called when the invocation execution is aborted.
        This method may be called at any time after the invocation initialization.
        Parameters:
        reason - the reason of the abortion.
        Throws:
        Exception - if an unexpected error occurs.

      • onComplete

        void onComplete(@NotNull
                Channel<OUT,?> result)
         throws Exception
        Called when all the inputs has been passed to the invocation.
        This method is called once in the invocation lifecycle to indicate that the final invocation results should be passed to the result channel.
        Parameters:
        result - the result channel.
        Throws:
        Exception - if an unexpected error occurs.

      • onInput

        void onInput(IN input,
             @NotNull
             Channel<OUT,?> result)
      throws Exception
        Called when an input is passed to the routine.
        This method is called once for each input object.
        Parameters:
        input - the input.
        result - the result channel.
        Throws:
        Exception - if an unexpected error occurs.

      • onRecycle

        void onRecycle(boolean isReused)
        throws Exception
        Called when the routine invocation is recycled.
        Parameters:
        isReused - whether the invocation is going to be reused.
        Throws:
        Exception - if an unexpected error occurs.

      • onRestart

        void onRestart()
        throws Exception
        Called when the routine invocation is initialized.
        This is always the first method in the invocation lifecycle.
        Throws:
        Exception - if an unexpected error occurs.
